intro: Piper setebarraense var. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy sedge pepper, is a tropical vine native to Brazil. It belongs to the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by elongated, fleshy fruits. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in humid, lowland forests and is valued for its aromatic properties.
